title: Fallas Valencia 2026 Survival Guide: 15 Tips You Actually Need
excerpt: Las Fallas is five days of controlled chaos across an entire city — 750+ burning monuments, daily gunpowder explosions, 2M visitors. This guide covers the practical things that will make or break your experience.

snippets.code:
WHAT TO PACK:

1. Earplugs — La Mascleta is painfully loud
2. Comfortable walking shoes — 12-18 km/day
3. Portable battery pack — your phone will die
4. Light layers — 12-20°C in March
5. Small daypack — water, battery, snacks

KEY DATES:
15-19 March: Main festival
18 March: La Ofrenda (flower procession)
19 March: La Crema (all monuments burn)

QUÉ LLEVAR:

1. Tapones para los oídos — La Mascleta duele
2. Calzado cómodo — 12-18 km al día
3. Batería portátil — tu móvil va a morir
4. Capas ligeras — 12-20°C en marzo
5. Mochila pequeña — agua, batería, comida

FECHAS CLAVE:
15-19 marzo: Festival principal
18 marzo: La Ofrenda (procesión de flores)
19 marzo: La Crema (se queman todos los monumentos)

title: This Developer's Dog Is Now a Game Dev (Sort Of)
excerpt: A dev rigged up an AI vibe coding setup where their dog presses buttons and the AI generates actual game logic. It hit 1042 upvotes on HN — turns out the barrier to game dev is now literally paw-level.

snippets.code:
KEY POINTS:

- Developer built a physical input setup letting their dog trigger AI game generation
- The AI (vibe coding tools) interprets button presses and produces game logic
- No traditional coding required — the dog is a legitimate co-creator
- Went viral on HN with 1042 points, sparking debate about what 'programming' even means
- Highlights how abstracted AI coding tools have become from actual code
- The real story: vibe coding has removed humans from the loop — pets optional

title: Denmark's Government Is Done with Microsoft
excerpt: Denmark's Agency for Digital Government is moving off Microsoft software in favor of open-source alternatives, citing digital sovereignty and cost. It's one of the largest public-sector Microsoft exits in Europe.

snippets.code:
KEY POINTS:

- Denmark's Agency for Digital Government officially plans to exit Microsoft ecosystem
- Primary drivers: digital sovereignty + long-term cost reduction
- Follows a broader EU trend of governments reducing dependency on US tech vendors
- Open-source stack will replace Microsoft Office, cloud, and collaboration tools
- No hard deadline announced, but the direction is firm
- Similar moves seen in Germany (Schleswig-Holstein) and France (Gendarmerie)
- Vendor lock-in and data residency concerns are accelerating the shift across Europe

title: Claude Code Now Has a Remote Control API
excerpt: Anthropic shipped remote control for Claude Code — developers can now drive Claude Code instances programmatically via API, enabling fully automated coding pipelines and agent-to-agent workflows. This turns Claude Code from a dev tool into an orchestratable coding engine.

snippets.code:
KEY POINTS:

- Claude Code can now be controlled remotely via API (not just CLI/interactive mode)
- Enables programmatic automation: trigger code edits, file ops, and tasks from external systems
- Key use case: agent-driven development — one AI orchestrating Claude Code as a sub-agent
- Opens the door to CI/CD pipelines that use Claude Code as an autonomous coding step
- Auth and session management handled through the API
- Documented at code.claude.com/docs/en/remote-control
- Signals Anthropic positioning Claude Code as infrastructure, not just a dev assistant
